titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Gathering of the Tribes Archive
1983-2006
MSS 198
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Martin, 2014

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-06-09T16:03-0400

physdesc.extent: (13 records cartons, 1 document case, 7 binders, 1 large oversize box)

did.abstract: The Gathering of the Tribes Archive includes correspondence, manuscripts, ephemera, photographic material, business and administrative records, video, audio, legal and financial records related to the operations of A Gathering of the Tribes, a literary magazine, gallery and performance space in New York's East Village.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Gathering of the tribes (Fly By Night Press).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Gathering of the Tribes Archive; MSS 198; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections is not the copyright owner for this collection. Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Researchers wishing to reproduce collection material should contact rights holders for permission.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Gathering of the Tribes Archive was purchased by NYU's Fales Library and Special Collections from Steve Cannon in 2007.

p.extref: The Bob Holman Audio/Video Poetry Collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
The Gathering of the Tribes Archive contains correspondence, manuscripts, ephemera, photographic material, business and administrative records, video, audio, legal and financial records. Materials in the archive document the operations of A Gathering of the Tribes, a literary magazine, gallery and performance space, and its publishing imprint, Fly By Night Press. The collection is arranged into seven series:
Series I: Media contains the audiovisual portion of the collection, inclusing video and audio cassettes.
Series II: Scrapbooks contains binders of material compiled by Tribes employees related to the gallery space, including ephemera, photographic material and event documentation.
Series III: Project Files contains files related to events, publications, and exhibitions, including correspondence, ephemera, artists' portfolios, and manuscripts.
Series IV: Grant Applications contains the records of all grant applications drafted by A Gathering of the Tribes.
Series VI: Publications contains printed material either published by, or associated with, A Gathering of the Tribes and Fly By Night Press.
Series VII: Data Storage contains electronic media, including compact discs and floppy discs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The archive was arranged into six series based on the organization of items upon their arrival to the library. Archival materials were arranged at the folder level, alphabetically by folder title. Folder contents remain in the order in which they arrived at the library. Wherever possible, original folders were retained, numbered and described. Some folders were replaced due to preservation concerns. Materials that were too large for their original folders were rehoused in oversize boxes or into a map-case drawer. Audiovisual and media items were described at the item level. Scrapbooks were rehoused in archival binders for safe storage and access.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: A Gathering of the Tribes is a literary magazine, gallery and performance space in New York's East Village. Founded in 1991 by Steve Cannon in his apartment, Tribes began as an informal salon for cultural exchange between poets, artists, musicians and performers. The collaborative, explorative work done in the space culminated in the founding of the Gathering of the Tribes magazine, whose first issue was published in the autumn of 1991. In 1993, part of the space became the Tribes Gallery, which plays host to exhibitions, readings, and performances.

Since its inception, A Gathering of the Tribes has sought to engage with and promote work from multi-cultural, interdisciplinary, and underrepresented writers and artists. Those featured at the gallery or published in the magazine include Ishmael Reed, Wynton Marsalis, Anyssa Kim, David Hammons, and Dora Espinoza. Tribes also publishes work under its Fly By Night Press imprint. Still in operation, Tribes remains a vibrant contributor to the East Village literary, artistic and performance scene alongside such venues as Nuyorican Poets Cafe and the Living Theatre.
"About." A Gathering of the Tribes. Web. 20 May 2014. http://www.tribes.org/web/about/.
For more information, please visit http://www.tribes.org .

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Four issues of A Gathering of the Tribes were removed from the archive to be catalogued. They can be found in the Fales Library's Downtown Collection, via Bobcat.

controlaccess.subject: East Village (New York, N.Y.)
controlaccess.title: Gathering of the Tribes (Fly By Night Press)
Nuyorican Poets Cafe
controlaccess.subject: Poetry |x Slams.
Publishers and publishing |z New York (State) |z New York |y 20th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains audiovisual materials related to A Gathering of the Tribes, many containing footage of poetry and jazz performances in the Tribes Gallery and elsewhere.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items were given individual ID numbers and described at the item level. Titles are arranged chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains scrapbooks maintained by the Gathering of the Tribes staff, documenting events and publications. Each scrapbook holds an arrangement of photographs, ephemera, and clippings related to the gallery and magazine.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials from each scrapbook were rehoused, in their original order, into archival storage binders.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by file title.

did.unittitle: Equinox: Collected Poems, by Barbara Chase-Riboud
A Gathering of the Tribes, Issue #6 Galleys
A Gathering of the Tribes, Issue #9 Galleys
A Gathering of the Tribes Press Package
Get Off That Alligator!, by Martin Marriott
